title: Ghost game bug
body:
So I 'won' a game a few minutes ago. We destroyed the nexus, I clicked the continue sign after the win and after being stuck in the loading screen for the game stats etc. I just skipped waiting for stats as I couldnt be bothered to wait for them.

After a few minutes my game hasn't registered on my match history so i log off and log back in thinking it might work after a log off. Now im here trying to reconnect to a game that doesnt exist claiming im not connected. 

Idk what to do about it... Thanks..

replies.body: Got the same problem after a hexakill match, the game hasn't shown up on my match history on this site either :/ haven't been able to get off that screen for forty minutes or so now, doesn't matter if I log out or disconnect the net or try to actually connect, nothing seems to work.

~~Ghost games will often also cause match history delays. Don't worry, that will sort itself out on it's own as well.~~

Ghost games are essentially lost and so will not be recorded on match history or promos, and will not give LP or IP.

The ghost game itself (the stuck reconnecting) will USUALLY resolve itself in a max of two hours. In rare cases it can be up to 8.

I was mistaken about the match history, I had the impression it would update, but I've been informed that ghost games are basically lost and so won't be recorded.

Seems you did indeed experience a ghost game. This happens when the game server you were playing on fails to communicate the game-end message to PVP.Net.

The ghost game will fix on it's own, and usually lasts a maximum of 2 hours after this occurs. Sometimes this issue can be fixed by relogging into League of Legends. Occasionally, restarting your computer may help. These actions force the client to request a new update.
